The Reproduction Number R (for a disease) expresses how many persons are likely to get the disease from a person who has this disease. 


• If R < 1, then the number of infected persons decreases exponentially over time. 
 • If R > 1, then the number of infected persons increases exponentially over time. 
 • If R = 1, then the number of infected persons remains constant.
